reviewText: An ordinary midlife crisis takes a surreal turn in this impressive second film from independent director Kevin Corcoran. Combining the mundane realism of home and office with sumptuously rendered landscapes of postindustrial ruin, "The Cracked Man" traces the journey of a 40-year-old family man and corporate drone from middle-class comfort to exile to an eventual (though disturbing) redemption in a community of freakish outcasts perched on the edge of the world.
